title: Dark Tourism at the Catacombs & General Cemetery of Lima
description:
A unique and different experience!

Discover the history of Peru, through death, visiting the famous colonial catacombs built under the churches and the general cemetery "Presbítero Maestro", built in 1808, which is the oldest public cemetery in America with more than 700 mausoleums!

We will learn the history of Peru chronologically, visiting the Plaza de Armas of Lima to talk about the founding of the City of Kings by Francisco Pizarro and how the city evolved into the most magnificent city in Latin America. Visit the convent of San Francisco, the largest in Lima and its catacombs to discover what life was like for the citizens of the colonial era. 

Finish the tour discovering one of the hidden treasures of Lima, the Matías Maestro cemetery and its beautiful neoclassical mausoleums. Visit the pavilion of suicides, the crypt of heroes and more!
all_descriptions:
A unique and different experience!

Discover the history of Peru, through death, visiting the famous colonial catacombs built under the churches and the general cemetery "Presbítero Maestro", built in 1808, which is the oldest public cemetery in America with more than 700 mausoleums!

We will learn the history of Peru chronologically, visiting the Plaza de Armas of Lima to talk about the founding of the City of Kings by Francisco Pizarro and how the city evolved into the most magnificent city in Latin America. Visit the convent of San Francisco, the largest in Lima and its catacombs to discover what life was like for the citizens of the colonial era. 

Finish the tour discovering one of the hidden treasures of Lima, the Matías Maestro cemetery and its beautiful neoclassical mausoleums. Visit the pavilion of suicides, the crypt of heroes and more!

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Museo Convento San Francisco y Catacumbas, Jiron Ancash, Lima 15001 PeruCatacumbasDuration: 1 hourStop At:Presbitero Maestro, Jr. Ancash 1611, Cuadra 17 District - Barrios Altos, Lima PeruMausoleums & criptsDuration: 2 hours

We had a great tour. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. Cost was fair and our guide spent a lot of time explaining the highlights.
The cemetery was something we had never seen before.

Great tour

A very informative and entertaining afternoon.

Sadie Y
2 contributions

The highlight of my short time in Lima!

Nov 2024 • Family
The highlight of my short time in Lima! This was such an amazing tour. It was unique and fascinating to see and learn about both the catacombs and the cemetery. I’ve always had a love for bones and cemeteries and having a private tour getting to learn about the Peruvian death traditions was an incredible experience. Our guide was awesome! Jean had a unique perspective on everything we saw and was very knowledgeable about more than just the catacombs and the cemetery. If you have any interest in activities slightly off the beaten path, or the darker side of Lima, I definitely recommend this tour! It was even better than I expected!
Written November 17, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Heather J
11 contributions

Insightful and sometimes spooky!

Sep 2024 • Family
Marco was our tour guide and he was fantastic. Really knowledgeable about many things, even outside of the funeral industry in Lima. Looking into the death of a culture can tell you a lot about how life is lived there. We talked a lot about the practicalities of burial but we also talked spooky stuff too. Highly recommend this tour.
Written September 27, 2024

London
United States13 contributions

Must do if looking for a UNIQUE history filled experience!

This tour is a MUST do if you are interested in checking out the Catacombs AND the largest cemetery in the America's! I had previously did a catacombs tour that was included as part of a city tour and it just seemed rushed! I really appreciated the extra time taken by my tour guide Jean who made sure I had all the history and answered any additional questions I had! I learned soooo much in the short time we were in the catacombs! Since it was a private tour, I elected to spend more time at the cemetery and I was def worth it!! I was AMAZED and also learned a LOT from this portion of the tour! I really liked that the vehicle was air conditioned, door pickup, the history lesson while on the way to the locations AND the Peruvian Churro as a snack! I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Lima that wants to do something a little less traditional! What a unique experience!
Written January 26, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
lisa g
11 contributions

Great tour with a great guide

Marco was amazing, treated us with respect and made sure we had fun while we learned about the culture. The cemetery tour was very interesting. Loved it, highly recommend.
Written November 21, 2023
